State the decision rule regarding the hypothesis. Using the sample sizes for the two
industries, the critical F-value for our test is found to be 1.74. This value is obtained
from the table of the F-distribution at the 5% level of significance with df, = 30 and
df, = 40. Thus, if the computed F-statistic is greater than the critical value of 1.74,
the null hypothesis is rejected. The decision rule, illustrated in the figure below, can be
